item.title: cat
item.author: Enthusiastic Hugo User
item.description: Etiam at risus et justo dignissim congue. Donec congue lacinia dui, a porttitor lectus condimentum laoreet. Nunc eu ullamcorper orci. Quisque eget odio ac lectus vestibulum faucibus eget in metus. In pellentesque faucibus vestibulum. Nulla at nulla justo, eget luctus tortor. Nulla facilisi. Duis aliquet egestas purus in blandit. Curabitur vulputate, ligula lacinia scelerisque tempor, lacus lacus ornare ante, ac egestas est urna sit amet arcu. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos himenaeos. Sed molestie augue sit amet leo consequat posuere. Vestibulum ante ipsum primis in faucibus.

item.title: December 12th: Angel Fest
item.author: Enthusiastic Hugo User
item.description:
This November, strap on your wings and join the movement as Bashaw United Church challenges the community to perform more than 100 random Acts of Angels in just 40 days! From Nov 1st to Dec 12th community members are being challenged to catch others in the act of doing good or spreading love, and report those Acts of Angels by using the "Angel Cards" found around town at various locations, or by using the hashtag #BashawAngels on social media. We will be collecting those Angels Among Us stories and sharing them with the community through Facebook, and also by adding them to the Angels Among Us Exhibit - a collection of stories posted on laminated Angel cards on the front lawn of the Bashaw United Church.

The Facebook Page "Angels Among Us" has already reached tens of thousands of people in the last 2 weeks, and the angels on the lawn of the church are quickly starting to multiply! And we know this is only going to continue growing, with your support. The Angels Among Us challenge wraps up on December 12th with "Angel Fest"; a fun, family festival featuring a full day of events for community members of all ages. Check out the schedule of events and mark your calendars!

Schedule

8:30 a.m. Check In Angel Fun Run & Walk - Registration is $25 (preschoolers FREE)
10:00 a.m. Start Strap on your wings, shine up your halo and make your way through our community angel route. Prizes for top pledge earners and a souvenir toque for every participant.
10am - 3pm Silent Angel Auction
Angel themed silent auction items on display for bidding all day.
10am - 3pm Angel Photo Booth
Bring your friends and family and pose together in our angel photo booth after finding the perfect angel gear in our costume trunk!
10am - 3pm Angel Food Bake Sale
Stock up on some heavenly Christmas goodies at our special Angel Food Bake Sale.
4:00 p.m. Angels Assemble!
Take a seat and watch the cutest actors you’ve ever seen take the stage in this angel themed Christmas theatre production.
5:00 p.m. Angel Hair Spaghetti Supper
End the day with one final stroll through the silent auction items at the church and warm up with a delicious noodle and sauce extravaganza!

Click here to register for the 5K Angel Fun Run & Walk, and take advantage of the Early Bird Rate of $20 before Nov 30th!

If you would like to donate an item for the Angel Auction or Bake Sale, or if you're interested in volunteering with any of the Angel Fest events, please Contact Us.

item.title: Nov 13th Movie Night: The Book Thief
item.author: Enthusiastic Hugo User
item.description:
Movie Night: The Book Thief. In Nazi Germany, a little girl finds solace in books and reading them to the Jewish man that her adoptive parents are hiding in the basement.

PG-13, 2013, 131 mins.

Popcorn provided, please bring a drink.

It’s Free - you can make a donation if you like.

item.title: Sunday Sermon Oct 18, 2015
item.author: Enthusiastic Hugo User
item.description:
Scripture Readings:

Job 38:1–7, (34–41) God’s rebuttal to Job’s complaint.

Psalm 104:1–9, 24, 35c With wisdom, God created the earth and all its creatures.

Hebrews 5:1–10 Christ learned obedience and was made perfect.

Mark 10:35–45 James and John request to sit on Jesus’ right and left.

item.title: Oct 30th Family Movie Night: Book of Life
item.author: Enthusiastic Hugo User
item.description:
Halloween Family Movie: Book of Life.

Manolo faces his fears on a fantastic journey through the Land of the Remembered and the Lord of the Forgotten on his way to finding true love.

Animated, PG, 2014, 95 mins.

Treats provided, please bring a drink.

  asdfIt’s Free - you can make a donation if you like.

item.title: Sunday Sermon Oct 4, 2015
item.author: Enthusiastic Hugo User
item.description:
World Communion Sunday

Scripture Readings:

Job 1:1; 2:1–10 Job’s first affliction; faith intact.

Psalm 26 Prove me, try me, test my heart.

Hebrews 1:1–4; 2:5–12 God gave the world to humans, not angels.

Mark 10:2–16 Question of divorce; Jesus blesses children.

item.title: November Sunday Services
item.author: Enthusiastic Hugo User
item.description:
November 1 - All Saints Sunday: Angels Among Us Saints Alive! Finding the saints in our lives. Children invited to wear their Halloween costumes.

November 8 - Remembrance Sunday

November 15 - Pentecost 25
Something’s Coming!

November 22 - Children’s Sunday
The last Sunday of the church calendar: the church’s “New Year’s Eve.”

November 29 - First Sunday of Advent
